content.description:
Winner Takes It All is the second bolt line from the left. There's the obvious

Planetary Mirror

a few feet to the left, and this route is two big steps to the right.
content.location: This is the 2nd bolt line from the left of the wall. As of 06/18/19, there is a missing a hanger on the first bolt, so it could be worth stickclipping.

content.description: Ths is the [now fourth] route you come to on this steep, short wall. It has slopey and technical climbing, fixed biners for lowering at the anchor, about six clips, I don't remember exactly. Probably you'll find the route to still be a bit chossy, but all major cleaning has been completed.

One of the cleaner routes at Fiscal Cliff, Truck Ram climbs the far left golden face on this half of Fiscal Cliff.

The crux is all in figuring out the beginning. A boulder problem with lots of options puts you above a small lip with easier but pleasant climbing to the top.
content.location: On the upriver half of Fiscal Cliff, this is the leftmost route. Start on an overhanging arete, and continue up the gold face.

content.description: The crux of this climb is pulling over the lip.
content.location:
It is the bolted line to the right of

Over the Top

.

content.description: Planetary Mirror has cool and crimpy opening moves to hero jug hauling at the top.
content.location: Start on the far left side of the Fiscal Cliff. These two lines share this start. Mirror, 12c takes the left line, and Planetary Mirror, 12d, goes right.

content.description:
Start up steep jugs to the lip of the cave. Continue with big moves and a sustained pump to the top of the wall. With a few cruxes along the way, it climbs longer than it appears.

It is still a bit dirty... traffic will clean this up into a very nice route.

This climbs better than it looks.

Begin with a committing step up over the first little roof, with the initial bolt just at your foot. Make a few feints to the left or right to clip, before climbing upwards in the opposite direction. Enjoy a balancy mantel before a powerful move to the anchors.
content.location: About halfway between the left and right sides of Fiscal Cliff is a left-facing corner with an obvious, pale, tan face seemingly crisscrossed with small ledges. The right wall of this corner is darker and more featured.

content.description:
A few crimps up a left-leaning, overhanging panel lead to big moves and a semi-respite at an alcove. Clip bolt 3 here, and head up the clean white panel above with some cool toe hook beta available. Reach right to clip bolt 5, and struggle up the easy looking final groove.

The start is a little contrived.

For full credit, begin on flat rock, but if, like me, you can't get off the ground, scramble a couple of feet up the ramp, and start on the crimp rail below bolt 1.

Consider stickclipping bolt 2. If you blow that clip, you may hit the ground.
content.location:
Currently this is the left most route at Fiscal Cliff and likely to remain so unless true choss appeals to some developer. It shares a start with

Planetary Mirror

on a left-leaning, overhanging panel.

content.description: Lot Lizards has mostly balancy climbing with a couple powerful moves through the roofs.
content.protection: 6 bolts and a 2 bolt drop-in anchor.
content.location:
In the upstream cave section, this is the second line of bolts from the right.

Per

Josh Thompson

: in the middle of the Fiscal Cliff, there's a collection of five bolted routes. Lot Lizards is the 2nd from the right of that group. It starts slightly slabby, goes vertical, and then you have to work out a small roof to get to the chains.

content.description: Large Marge has nice double roof cruxes. They are not the most obvious sequence sthrough each (personally), but it is all there once deciphered.
content.location: It is on the upstream roof section, through the v-notch.

content.description: Joyride has fun, varied climbing on the right side of the upstream roof area. Start at the black streaks.
Joppa Road begins with a slabby/balancy start, goes through an off balance middle, and finishes through a roof. It has good variety. :)
content.location: In the upstream cave, it is the third bolt line from the right.

content.description:
Climb just left of the iron curtain that covers the wall. Sidepulls and incut crimps lead up to the cable you have to climb under. This has fun, easy climbing but probably needs to be cleaned and climbed more.

The construction workers graciously left both my climbs on this wall intact. You can see where they scraped the wall with the excavator bucket mere inches from the bolts I put in. They could have easily scraped my bolts right off.
content.protection:
Per

Mark E Dixon

: 8 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is just left of the iron curtain.

content.description: This is [now the fourth] route on the cliff. I find it to be very pumpy, technical, and sustained. Mike and I worked this route, and finally he got it with the draws on. I don't believe anyone has onsighted this, and it may be 12a if you walk up and get on it sight unseen.
content.protection: Six to eight draws, fixed lowering hooks on the anchors.

content.description:
This is just east of

The Iron Curtain

. It is still VERY dirty. Climb up the face to a left-facing dihedral. Lieback and straddle the dihedral to a small ledge. Trend a little right near the giant bolts for the iron curtain climbing sidepulls and rails to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 quickdraws and an anchor with Mussy hooks.
content.location: This is the leftmost climb of the 3 near the iron curtain.

content.description:
The climb shares 1st 2 bolts with

Glitter and Gloom

. Then head right, and pull the hard boulder problem over the bulge.

Follow black streaks upward just left of

Over the Top

. Enjoy thin pinches and steep slope-iness to a difficult third clip. Pull a puzzling move over the lip, then head up and right to the anchors on

OTP

, clipping that route's last bolt on the way.

Climb relatively easily up to the second bolt (consider pre-hanging this draw if you have fat fingers). Move right and up past bolt 3 to a "ledge," and continue up the black groove. Reach left to clip bolt 4 then cruise to the top. This is a little dirtier and looser than most of the Fiscal routes, but it has good, challenging movement through the crux.
content.location:
Begin about 8 feet right of

The Road

just left of a narrow, chossy groove and well left of the big, chossy groove.

content.description: Start on the ledge with lots of loose dirt and blocks. The crux comes in the first 2 bolts with some thin moves up the clean slab. Continue up on positive holds with fun moves.
content.protection: [8] quickdraws [to an anchor with Mussy hooks].
content.location: This is the farthest route to the right on Fiscal Cliff and climbs the tallest clean slab of rock.
